Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
meaning unknown; possibly: = musical term; or: = musical instrument; or: = melody; ≈ possibly associated with the winepress (גַּת) or with the town of Gath (גַּת)
= a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= pertaining to inspiring awe and respect ◄ because of one's beauty, size, strength, or status
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= a person of a young age, usually before puberty
= a child that is still drinking milk from its mother's breasts
literally: to lay the foundation of strength; hence: = action by which deities draw strength out of a certain event
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
= person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body
= one of the celestial bodies which govern time, seasons and other events on earth, marked by a white and cold light and seen by night

= celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities bring an object into existence

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to take notice|to be mindful (of someone, something)
Node.definition: = action by which deities or humans take notice of the misfortune or suffering of (other) humans, plants, or objects and intervene in order to help
= causative action by which deities cause humans to have a lesser status than other people
= small quantity of objects or substance

plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations|plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations|plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
literally: to crown; hence: = causative action by which deities increase the status and well being of humans by giving them certain qualities
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event

Node.gloss: to place (in a position)|to make|to appoint
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities give (other) humans a certain task or responsibility

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

= quantity of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)
= generic term for a small bird; ► usually clean and can therefore be eaten

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

= collective designation of various cold blooded, aquatic vertebrates, having gills, usually fins, and typically an elongated body covered with scales; or, in a loosely sense, any of various other aquatic animals; ► an important source of food
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= relatively narrow road (דֶּרֶךְ) that connects two locations and facilitates travelling
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= pertaining to inspiring awe and respect ◄ because of one's beauty, size, strength, or status
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
